optical fiber facing 光纤端面制备

轴外象差： off-axis aberration： 离轴椭球面镜： off-axis ellipsoidal mirror

sentence.Network_en: I feel it's done me good to get it off my chest.
sentence.Network_cn: 我感觉吐吐苦水对我有好处。

sentence.Network_en: Their first car rolls off the production line on December 16.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的第一辆车于12月16日下线。

sentence.Network_en: French soldiers squared off with a gunman at a road checkpoint.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一个公路检查站法国士兵摆开架势，准备迎战一名持枪者。

越野（Off Road）意味着你在征服大自然：泥泞、碎石路、小河流、沙漠、山峰等等均不在话下。想要达到这个目的，你一定要改装 …
九年级英语单词表 ... advertisement 广告 put off 推迟；延迟 set up 创建；开办.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, originally a variant of of (which combined the senses of 'of' and 'off')

entry.def: If something is taken off something else or moves off it, it is no longer touching that thing.

example.ex: He took his feet off the desk...
example.tran: 他把脚从桌上移开。

example.ex: I took the key for the room off a rack above her head...
example.tran: 我从她头上方的架子上拿走了房门钥匙。

entry.def: When you get off a bus, train, or plane, you come out of it or leave it after you have been travelling on it.

example.ex: Don't try to get on or off a moving train!...
example.tran: 火车运行时请勿上下车！

example.ex: As he stepped off the aeroplane, he was shot dead.
example.tran: 他一走下飞机便中枪身亡。

entry.def: If you keep off a street or piece of land, you do not step on it or go there.

example.ex: Locking up men does nothing more than keep them off the streets...
example.tran: 把这些人关起来只是做到了不让他们上街而已。

example.ex: The local police had warned visitors to keep off the beach at night.
example.tran: 当地警方告诫游客不要在夜间去海滩。

entry.def: If something is situated off a place such as a coast, room, or road, it is near to it or next to it, but not exactly in it.

example.ex: The boat was anchored off the northern coast of the peninsula...
example.tran: 这艘船停泊在离该半岛北部海岸不远的地方。

example.ex: Lily lives in a penthouse just off Park Avenue...
example.tran: 莉莉住在公园大道附近的一套顶层豪华公寓里。

entry.def: If you go off, you leave a place.

example.ex: He was just about to drive off when the secretary came running out...
example.tran: 他正打算驾车离开，这时秘书跑了出来。

example.ex: She gave a hurried wave and set off across the grass...
example.tran: 她匆匆地挥了挥手便穿过草地离开了。

entry.tran: （用于非正式及有时具冒犯性的短语动词）（走）开，（滚）开
entry.def: Off is used in a number of informal and sometimes offensive phrasal verbs, such as buzz off ,clear off, or in British English bugger off, which are used to tell someone angrily to go away.
When you take off clothing or jewellery that you are wearing, you remove it from your body.

example.ex: He took off his spectacles and rubbed frantically at the lens...
example.tran: 他摘下眼镜，疯狂地擦着镜片。

example.ex: He hastily stripped off his old uniform and began pulling on the new one.
example.tran: 他匆匆地脱下旧制服，开始穿上新的那件。

entry.tran: （因生病、放假等等）休息，不工作
entry.def: If you have time off or a particular day off, you do not go to work or school, for example because you are ill or it is a day when you do not usually work.

example.ex: The rest of the men had the day off...
example.tran: 其他人这天没上班。

example.ex: You can even snatch a few hours off, and perhaps negotiate the occasional night off too...
example.tran: 你甚至可以抽空休息几小时，商量一下的话没准还能偶尔不用上晚班。

entry.def: If you keep off a subject, you deliberately avoid talking about it.

example.ex: Keep off the subject of politics...
example.tran: 勿谈政治。

example.ex: Keep the conversation off linguistic matters.
example.tran: 避谈语言学问题。

entry.def: If something such as an agreement or a sporting event is off, it is cancelled.

example.ex: Until Pointon is completely happy, however, the deal's off...
example.tran: 但是，在波因顿完全满意之前，这一协议不再作数。

example.ex: The vacant W.B.C. junior-lightweight title has been called off...
example.tran: 空缺的世界拳击理事会次轻量级头衔被取消了。

entry.def: If someone is off something harmful such as a drug, they have stopped taking or using it.

example.ex: She felt better and the psychiatrist took her off drug therapy...
example.tran: 她感觉好些了，那位精神科医生让她停止了药物治疗。

example.ex: Most pregnant women remain off cigarettes while carrying the child.
example.tran: 大多数孕妇都在孕期戒了烟。

entry.def: If you are off something, you have stopped liking it.

example.ex: I'm off coffee at the moment...
example.tran: 我眼下不再嗜咖啡了。

example.ex: Diarrhoea can make you feel weak, as well as putting you off your food.
example.tran: 腹泻会让人感到乏力，而且没有胃口。

entry.tran: （机器、电灯等）关掉，停掉，不再运转
entry.def: When something such as a machine or electric light is off, it is not functioning or in use. When you switch it off, you stop it functioning.

example.ex: As he pulled into the driveway, he saw her bedroom light was off...
example.tran: 当他把车开进车道时，他看到她卧室的灯已经熄了。

example.ex: We used sail power and turned the engine off to save our fuel...
example.tran: 我们借助风帆的动力航行，且关掉了发动机以节省燃油。

entry.def: If there is money off something, its price is reduced by the amount specified.

example.ex: ...Simons Leatherwear, 37 Old Christchurch Road. 20 per cent off all jackets this Saturday.
example.tran: 本周六老基督堂路37号的西蒙斯皮衣店所有夹克降价20％。

example.ex: ...discounts offering thousands of pounds off the normal price of a car.
example.tran: 比平时车价低几千英镑的折扣

entry.def: If something is a long way off, it is a long distance away from you.

example.ex: Florida was a long way off...
example.tran: 佛罗里达离这儿很远。

example.ex: ...animals that from a long way off look like flies...
example.tran: 远看像苍蝇的动物

entry.def: If something is a long time off, it will not happen for a long time.

example.ex: An end to the crisis seems a long way off...
example.tran: 这场危机看来远未结束。

example.ex: The required technology is probably still two years off.
example.tran: 所需技术可能还要两年才能开发出来。

entry.def: If you get something off someone, you obtain it from them.

example.ex: I don't really get a lot of information, and if I do I get it off Mark...
example.tran: 我得到的信息其实不多，即使有也是马克告诉我的。

example.ex: I can't find the boys' shampoo. I can't think where I put it when I took it off them...
example.tran: 我找不到那帮家伙的洗发水了，从他们那里拿来后我就忘了搁在什么地方。

entry.tran: （与well,badly,worse等副词连用构成形容词）表示“处于…境况的”
entry.def: Off combines with adverbs such as 'well', 'badly', and 'worse' to form adjectives that indicate how poor or rich someone is.

example.ex: Most of these people aren't very well off...
example.tran: 这些人大都不算太富裕。

example.ex: Surely you can't be that badly off?...
example.tran: 你肯定没那么穷吧？

entry.def: If food has gone off, it tastes and smells bad because it is no longer fresh enough to be eaten.

example.ex: Don't eat that! It's mouldy. It's gone off!
example.tran: 别吃那个！它已经发霉变质了！

entry.def: If you live off a particular kind of food, you eat it in order to live. If you live off a particular source of money, you use it to live.

example.ex: Her husband's memories are of living off roast chicken and drinking whisky...
example.tran: 她丈夫只记得过去吃烤鸡、喝威士忌的日子。

example.ex: Antony had been living off the sale of his own paintings.
example.tran: 安东尼一直靠卖自己的画为生。

entry.tran: （机器）靠（某种燃料或动力运转）
entry.def: If a machine runs off a particular kind of fuel or power, it uses that power in order to function.

example.ex: The Auto Compact Disc Cleaner can run off batteries or mains.
example.tran: 这种光盘自动清洗机可用电池或电源两种方式驱动。

entry.tran: （行为）过头的，不当的，无法接受的
entry.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is a bit off, you mean that you find it unacceptable or wrong.

example.ex: ...coming home with make-up all over his clothes — it's a bit off isn't it...
example.tran: 衣服上到处沾着化妆品回到家——他这样有点过分了，是不是。

example.ex: Some of the dialogue is slightly off.
example.tran: 部分对话有些不太得体。

entry.def: If something happens on and off, or off and on, it happens occasionally, or only for part of a period of time, not in a regular or continuous way.

example.ex: I was still working on and off as a waitress to support myself...
example.tran: 我为了糊口仍然间或去做服务员。

example.ex: We lived together, off and on, for two years.
example.tran: 我们断断续续在一起生活了两年。

means.word_mean: 3. (of events) no longer planned or scheduled;
5. not performing or scheduled for duties;

sentences.sentence: "he was off duty when it happened"

means.word_mean: 1. from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete);

sentences.sentence: "sent the children away to boarding school"
"the teacher waved the children away from the dead animal"

means.word_mean: 2. at a distance in space or time;

sentences.sentence: "the party is still 2 weeks off (or away)"

means.word_mean: 3. no longer on or in contact or attached;

example.en: How are they hitting it off these days?
example.zh: 他们现在相处得怎么样？

example.en: They hit it off from the start.
example.zh: 他们从一开始就很合得来。

example.en: He hit it off with the whole class.
example.zh: 他深受全班欢迎。

list.explanation: 采取断然或激烈的行动

example.en: He jumped off the deep end and got married again.
example.zh: 他断然地采取了行动，并且再次结了婚。

example.en: Hey. back off a little. I don't get you.
example.zh: 喂，说慢一点，我听不淸。

list.explanation: 把(某人)撵出门外(尤指在酒吧等公共场所)

example.en: The bouncer of hotel backed a drunkard off.
example.zh: 旅馆警卫把一名酒鬼撵出门外。

list.explanation: (对某事物)十分感兴趣、有好感

example.en: I've listened to the stuff,but I sure don't get my rocks off on it.
example.zh: 我听过那东时，不过我实在对它很不感兴趣。

example.en: Musically …to break time out of tempos is to brown off.
example.zh: 就音乐方面来说…拍子脱离节奏就是出错。

list.explanation: 包庇某人，为某人开脱责任

example.en: He falls for Uona and winds up trying to get her off the hook.
example.zh: 他爱上了伊洛娜，最后竟想包庇她过关。

example.en: Whether you make it or not,it's no skin off my ass.
example.zh: 不管你做不做得成，跟我都没关系。

list.explanation: l大声说话(尤指长时间发牢骚)

example.en: The leaders have sounded off on various issues.
example.zh: 头头们在许多问题上大发了中牢骚。

example.en: Don't just sound off without raising your hand.
example.zh: 你没举手,就不要发言。

example.en: He's always sounding off about what a big shot he is.
example.zh: 他动不动就吹嘘自己是什么了不起的大人物。

example.en: Keep it a secret. Don't sound off about it.
example.zh: 这事要保守秘密，不要泄露出去。

example.en: The piano lid fell and scared the pants off my parents.
example.zh: 钢琴盖突然倒了下来，把我的爹妈吓了一大跳。

example.en: Max smokes nothing but those off-brand cigarette.
example.zh: 麦克斯除了那种大麻烟，什么也不抽。

list.explanation: 完全错的，在错误道上的

example.en: I think you're way off base. Try again!
example.zh: 我认为你完全错了。再试一试吧!

example.en: Sorry. You are way off. You shoutd just give up.
example.zh: 很遗憾。你的方法不对头。你只能放弃。

example.en: The store manager knocked 30 percent off the price of the coat.
example.zh: 商店经理将外套的价格降低了百分之三十。

example.en: They knocked off four window frames in an hour.
example.zh: 他们在一小时内仓促地赶做了四副窗架。

example.en: He knocked off a poem in 10 minutes.
example.zh: 他在十分钟内即席做了一首诗。

example.en: He knocked off 3 opponents.
example.zh: 他打败了三个对手。

example.en: You couldn't knock off every objection.
example.zh: 你不能排除一切异议。

example.en: One of those guys got knocked off.
example.zh: 这些家伙中有一个被干掉了。

example.en: The pair knocked off several shops, a bank，and some jewelry stores.
example.zh: 这俩人抢了几个铺子，一家银行和几家珠宝店。

example.en: Local cops had free authority to knock them off.
example.zh: 当地警察完全有权拘捕他们。

example.en: To everybody's astonishment, the scheme came off.
example.zh: 令人吃惊的是这一计划居然成功了。

list.explanation: 使某人生气，惹恼怒某人

example.en: What he did really browned me off.
example.zh: 他的所作所为确实让我气恼。

example.en: I'm afraid I'm going to brown off everyone，but here goes anyway.
example.zh: 恐怕我会得罪大家，但是不管怎么样，我还是得这么做.。

list.explanation: 发疯的，失去理性的，发狂的

example.en: You silly clown. You're off your chump.
example.zh: 你这愚蠢的小丑。你这是在发疯。

example.en: You seem half off your chump this morning.
example.zh: 今天早上，你好傢有点失去埋智了。

example.en: They did a suck-off thing.
example.zh: 他们干了一件见不得人的事。

list.explanation: (人)被欺诈的，受剥削的，遭抢幼的，(指东西)偷来的

example.en: I can determine that his car's ripped-off.
example.zh: 我可以断是，他那辆车是偷来的。

list.explanation: 生气的，大为不快的，恼火的，厌烦的，失望的

example.en: His face got all red-colored whenever he was pissed off.
example.zh: 他生气，就涨得满脸通红。

example.en: He gets a little p'd like I'm making fun of him.
example.zh: 他有点动气了,好像以为我是在取笑他。

example.en: I was peed off to hear that party had been cancelled.
example.zh: 听说聚会被取消了，我很失望。

list.explanation: 喋喋不休，说个不停(尤指劝说或争论)

example.en: I talked my head off trying to convince them.
example.zh: 我不停地劝说，竭力想说服他们。

example.en: Stop shooting your mouth off. Nobody believes you any more.
example.zh: 别再瞎吹了。没人再相信你了。

example.en: She hauled off and decked him.
example.zh: 她破口大骂，并狠狠揍了他一拳。

slang.tokens: Shit or get off the pot.

list.explanation: (常用于表示不满或提出要求)不能举棋不定。应当机立断

example.en: The union leader wamed that the city had until Feb. 1 to shit or get off the pot.
example.zh: 工会领抽警告说，市政当局在2月1日之前必须作出决定。

list.explanation: 准许外卖酒类饮料的许可证，持有外卖酒类许可证的酒店或酒馆

example.en: Bill had called at the beer-off by the street-end.
example.zh: 比尔在大街尽头那家外卖酒店逗留了一会儿。

example.en: I' m not just to'd off! I' m enraged.
example.zh: 我不仅仅是生气!我是火冒三丈。

auth_sentence.content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Turn off the heat and set the pan aside.

auth_sentence.content: In reality, that's not far off expectations.
auth_sentence.res_content: In reality, that's not far off expectations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In reality, that's not far off expectations.

auth_sentence.content: Rounding off the trio is Ready For The Floor.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rounding off the trio is Ready For The Floor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rounding off the trio is Ready For The Floor.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 不要胶片(照相测量系统)
政府官员，军官，警官，船长，军官，官员，职员
官方的，公务的，正式的；官员，行政人员

means.word_mean: (表示位置)在…的外面, 在…的沿海

sentences.en: The boat anchored off the fort.
The ship sank off the south coast of the island.
sentences.cn: 那艘船在岛的南岸沿海沉没。

sentences.en: It is a few minutes off three o'clock.

means.word_mean: (表示方向)从…, 通向, 偏离, 从…离开

sentences.en: The kitchen's off the dining room.
We are going off the subject.
They are selling the bikes off the market price.
sentences.cn: 他们按低于市价卖出自行车。

sentences.en: She's off work with a bad cold.
sentences.cn: 她因患重感冒而不上班。

sentences.en: He borrowed a pound off me.
This bear feeds off the leaves of the tree.
sentences.cn: 这只熊依靠这棵树的树叶生存。

sentences.en: He's had his beard shaved off.

means.word_mean: 休息的; 闲散的; 安静的

sentences.en: The winter is an off season.

jushi.english: He borrowed a pound off me.
The kitchen's off the dining room.
This bear feeds off the leaves of the tree.
jushi.chinese: 这只熊依靠这棵树的树叶生存。
